availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. McCampbell (Shelby County, Kentucky, Justice of the Peace, constable, 2nd lieut & capt 6th Ky Inf (USA))

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, constable, justice of the peace, and soldier. Shelby County, Kentucky, native. Son of John McCampbell and Mary Anna Lindy Campbell. Married to Sarah A. Tinsley McCampbell in Shelby County, Kentucky, on September 14, 1865. Constable in Shelby County in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Shelby County in 1861. Served in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U. S. A.) as a second lieutenant and captain from December 24, 1861, to January 4, 1865.
